dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 3176 IH: Protecting our National Parks Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Cook introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to establish a criminal violation for injuring or destroying property under the jurisdiction of the National Park Service, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting our National Parks Act of 2015.

section.header: Criminal penalties for injury or destruction of property under the jurisdiction of the National Park Service

subsection.header: Protection of National Park Service property
subsection.text: Chapter 65 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Destruction of property under the jurisdiction of the National Park Service
section.text: Whoever willfully injures or destroys, or attempts to injure or destroy, any property under the jurisdiction of the National Park Service shall be fined under this title, imprisoned not more than 10 years, or both.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 65 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: 1370. Destruction of property under the jurisdiction of the National Park Service.
